sentence.Network_en: Threats to reinstate the tax elicited jeer from the Opposition.
sentence.Network_cn: 恢复此项征税的威胁引起了反对党的嘲笑.

sentence.Network_en: Do not jeer at the mistakes or misfortunes of others.
sentence.Network_cn: 不要嘲笑别人的错误或不幸.

sentence.Network_en: Look at those saddos going to the Royal Opera House, I would jeer.
sentence.Network_cn: 看到那些去皇家歌剧院的蠢家伙，我会不屑一顾。

list.abs: They jeered the speaker off the stage ., 他们起哄把演讲人赶下台.
I was afraid of being jeer , till i learn how to jeer myself back ., 我本害怕嘲人 , 直到我学会如何自我解嘲.
she flinched as she was carried through angry , jeering crowd .她胆战心惊地被人抬着，穿过愤怒和嘲笑的人群。
Contemptuous or jeering laughter ; ridicule ., 嘲笑轻蔑的 , 嘲弄的笑容 ; 嘲弄.

entry.def: To jeer at someone means to say or shout rude and insulting things to them to show that you do not like or respect them.

example.ex: Marchers jeered at white passers-by, but there was no violence, nor any arrests...
example.tran: 游行者奚落路过的白人，但没有发生暴力事件，也没有人被逮捕。

example.ex: His motorcade was jeered by angry residents...
example.tran: 他的车队遭到愤怒的当地居民的嘲讽。

entry.def: Jeers are rude and insulting things that people shout to show they do not like or respect someone.

example.ex: He stared sullenly into space, pretending not to hear the jeers.
example.tran: 他面色阴郁地凝视前方，假装没听见那些冷嘲热讽。

example.ex: ...the heckling and jeers of his audience.
example.tran: 观众对他的起哄和嘲笑

means.word_mean: 1. laugh at with contempt and derision;

auth_sentence.content: I must admit Westminster is loving that spontaneous jeer moment.
auth_sentence.res_content: I must admit Westminster is loving that spontaneous jeer moment.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I must admit Westminster is loving that spontaneous jeer moment.

auth_sentence.content: Everyone can jeer and point at art they dislike or ignore.
auth_sentence.res_content: Everyone can jeer and point at art they dislike or ignore.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Everyone can jeer and point at art they dislike or ignore.

auth_sentence.content: They started to heckle and jeer.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They started to heckle and jeer.

sentences.en: The crowd jeered when the boxer was knocked down.
sentences.cn: 当那个拳击手被打倒时, 人们开始嘲笑他。
